roleset.name: board, get on a vehicle
roleset.note: BOARD-V NOTES: Frames file for 'board' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry butter-9.9. That doesn't seem right at all. (from board.01-v predicate notes)
BOARDING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. (from boarding.02-n)

example.name: all aboard!
example.text: Back downtown, [the execs]-1 squeezed in a few meetings at the hotel before *trace*-1 boarding the buses again.

example.name: arg1
example.text: He might say hi , but he might not since i stood him up when he asked if he could join me in zone 1 boarding .

roleset.name: live temporarily at some location
roleset.note: BOARD-V NOTES: Frames file for 'board' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry butter-9.9. That doesn't seem right at all. (from board.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: ARG0 subject
example.text: It was arranged that he would board in the home of one of the old members of the church , a woman named [*] Catt who , as Wilson afterward found , [*T*-1]was briefly referred to [*-2] as The Cat because of her sharp tongue and fierce initiative .
example.arg: in the home of one of the old members of the church , a woman named [*] Catt who , as Wilson afterward found , [*T*-1]was briefly referred to [*-2] as The Cat because of her sharp tongue and fierce initiative

example.name: with ARGA!
example.text: Maybe I did n't see as much of Gladdy as I 'd like [*?*] , but how much worse it would have been [*T*-1]if [I]*-2 'd had [*-2] to board her out somewhere after Alice went -- send my daughter to an orphanage or a boarding-home .

roleset.name: place a board over something (usually a window)
roleset.note: BOARD-V NOTES: this roleset solves the mystery of this verb's placement in butter-9.9 (from board.03-v)

example.name: adjectival
example.text: I looked back over my shoulder while I went [*] to join him ; ; he 'd hung another half of a blanket over the boarded window so no light would show through .

roleset.name: board_up: place boards over something extensively

example.name: adjectival
example.text: The dirty , discolored buildings looked boarded up , and their few windows stood high above our heads .

roleset.name: move by board (skate, snow, etc)
roleset.note: BOARDING-N NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Comparison to skate.01. Skate.01 is a member of VN class vehicle-51.4.1-1. Framed by Katie. (from boarding.01-n)

example.name: hmm..
example.text: Injury incurred while boarding off cliff.
